node.label: Clinical Dentistry
node.hasNote: The observation diagnosis and treatment of disease or damage to teeth and gums through direct interaction with human patients.

node.label: Clinical Medicine
node.hasNote: The observation diagnosis and treatment of an illness or disease through direct interaction with human patients.

node.label: Medicine and Dentistry not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Others in Medicine and Dentistry categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Others in Medicine and Dentistry
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Medicine and Dentistry categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Pre-clinical Dentistry
node.hasNote: Vocational science concerned with the diagnosis and treatment of damage disease and disorder to the teeth and gums of homo sapiens.

node.label: Pre-clinical Medicine
node.hasNote: Vocational science of preventing diagnosing alleviating or curing disease in homo sapiens. Includes such areas as Anatomy Physiology Pharmacy and Nutrition which can be specialisms in their own right.

node.label: Acupuncture
node.hasNote: The method of treating various conditions by pricking the skin or tissues with needles.

node.label: Adult Nursing
node.hasNote: The vocational study of the principles and techniques to allow nurses to provide care for adults.

node.label: Alternative Medicine
node.hasNote: Methods of diagnosis and treatment considered outside the scope of mainstream medicine in the UK.

node.label: Anatomy
node.hasNote: The scientific study of the structure and function of the human body including tissues organs and systems.

node.label: Anatomy Physiology and Pathology
node.hasNote: The study of the human body and how it is affected by disease. Taught by the dissection of cadavers use of microscope slides and interviewing patients. Includes study at a cellular level.

node.label: Anatomy Physiology and Pathology not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Anatomy Physiology and Pathology categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Aromatherapy
node.hasNote: The use of plant extracts and essential oils in massage.

node.label: Audiology
node.hasNote: The study of the anatomy and physiology of the human hearing organs their function and malfunction and related environmental and behavioural topics.

node.label: Aural and Oral Sciences
node.hasNote: The study of speech and hearing and problems that can occur with them. Includes the treatment of hearing defects and speech impediments.

node.label: Aural and Oral Sciences not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Aural and Oral Science categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Biomechanics Biomaterials and Prosthetics (non-clinical)
node.hasNote: The study of the mechanical laws relating to the movement and structure of the human body. Also the design and construction of artificial materials and devices for the purpose of regulating/replacing human tissues organs or limbs.

node.label: Cardiography
node.hasNote: The study of techniques aimed at diagnosing disorders of the human cardiovascular system.

node.label: Cellular Pathology
node.hasNote: The study of the effects and nature of diseases in cellular structures.

node.label: Chinese
node.hasNote: The range of medical techniques with roots in China such as moxibustion massage cupping gwa sha breath work (Qi Gong) and exercise (Tai Chi).

node.label: Chiropody
node.hasNote: The treatment of the feet and their ailments. Also called Podiatry.

node.label: Chiropractic
node.hasNote: The diagnosis and manipulative treatment of mechanical disorders of the joints.

node.label: Community Nursing
node.hasNote: The study of principles and techniques for the provision of care for the sick disabled and infirm within a community.

node.label: Complementary Medicine
node.hasNote: The prevention alleviation and treatment of illness or disease by techniques not covered within clinical medicine. Includes such areas as acupuncture osteopathy reflexology etc.

node.label: Complementary Medicine not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects not elsewhere classified. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Counselling
node.hasNote: The study of the provision of support services aimed at helping people to maintain a healthy and positive mental disposition in addressing problems.

node.label: Critical Care Nursing
node.hasNote: The study of principles and techniques for care of critically ill patients.

node.label: Dental Nursing
node.hasNote: The study of principles and techniques in providing assistance to dentists undertaking dental procedures and care to persons undergoing such procedures.

node.label: Dental Technology
node.hasNote: The study of the design and fabrication of dental prosthetics and restorative appliances.

node.label: Dietetics
node.hasNote: The study of nutritional services menu planning and diet formulation for individuals families and institutions.

node.label: District Nursing
node.hasNote: The vocational study of principles and techniques associated with the peripatetic care of individuals within a community.

node.label: Environmental Health
node.hasNote: The study of the monitoring and evaluation of health hazards and the planning and management of public health programmes.

node.label: Geriatric Nursing
node.hasNote: The vocational study of the principles and techniques to allow nurses to provide care for the elderly.

node.label: Health Visiting
node.hasNote: The study of the techniques of assisting elderly convalescent or disabled persons in their homes and providing for their physical mental and social health care needs.

node.label: Herbalism
node.hasNote: The use of herbs in the treatment of illness.

node.label: Hypnotherapy
node.hasNote: The treatment of disease by hypnosis.

node.label: Language Pathology
node.hasNote: The study of the principles and techniques of therapies for persons with physical or behavioural disorders that affect speaking or comprehension.

node.label: Learning Disability Nursing
node.hasNote: The study of the principles and techniques to provide support for learning needs.

node.label: Medical Nursing
node.hasNote: The study of principles and techniques to allow nurses to provide care to patients before and during surgery and to provide assistance to surgeons.

node.label: Medical Technology
node.hasNote: The study of the use and development of medical equipment and its potential including that used in radiography. Also involves understanding the effects of the various forms of radiation used to display and treat damage or illness.

node.label: Medical Technology not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Medical Technology categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Mental Health Nursing
node.hasNote: The study of principles and techniques to allow nurses to provide care for persons with mental emotional or behavioural disorders.

node.label: Midwifery
node.hasNote: The vocational study of principles and techniques to allow midwives to deliver babies and treat mothers in the pre-natal delivery and post-delivery periods.

node.label: Mortuary Technology
node.hasNote: The study of the techiques/processes and equipment relating to the storage of deceased human beings.

node.label: Neuroscience
node.hasNote: The study of the anatomy physiology biophysics biochemistry molecular biology and behaviour roles of neuron cells and biological nervous systems in humans.

node.label: Nursing
node.hasNote: Vocational science concerning the practical care of sick injured or infirm patients in hospital and the community. May include allied subjects in behavioural social and biological sciences.

node.label: Nursing not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Nursing categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Nutrition
node.hasNote: The study of the process of assimilating nutrient materials into animal or plant tissue. Designed to enhance health and the quality of life of those treated.

node.label: Nutrition not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Dietetics categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Occupational Health
node.hasNote: The monitoring and evaluation of health standards related to industrial and commercial workplaces and locations.

node.label: Occupational Therapy
node.hasNote: The study of therapeutic regimes to assist recovery from mental or physical ailments/injury.

node.label: Ophthalmics
node.hasNote: The study of the eye disruption to sight and diseases of the eye. Also includes treatment of eye disorders.

node.label: Ophthalmics not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Ophthalmic categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Optometry
node.hasNote: The study of the principles and techniques for examining diagnosing and treating conditions of the human visual system.

node.label: Orthoptics
node.hasNote: The study of principles and techniques for the correction of vision defects in humans using therapeutic exercises.

node.label: Osteopathy
node.hasNote: The treatment of disease through the manipulation of bones.

node.label: Others in Subjects allied to Medicine
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Subjects Allied to Medicine categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Paediatric Nursing
node.hasNote: The vocational study of the principles and techniques to allow nurses to provide care for children from infancy to adolescence.

node.label: Palliative Care Nursing
node.hasNote: The study of principles and techniques for the provision of palliative care of the sick disabled and infirm.

node.label: Paramedical Nursing
node.hasNote: The study of principles and techniques to allow nurses to provide on-site care for persons with acute illnesses or injuries.

node.label: Pathobiology
node.hasNote: The study of the biological nature of diseases.

node.label: Pathology
node.hasNote: The study of the nature causes and development of human diseases and the mechanisms of disease infestation and transfer.

node.label: Pharmacology
node.hasNote: The study of the therapeutic and toxic effects of drugs on human tissues and systems.

node.label: Pharmacology Toxicology and Pharmacy
node.hasNote: The study of drugs their characteristics actions and uses. Includes the study of poisons their nature effects and antidotes. Also includes how drugs and other chemicals interact with biological systems.

node.label: Pharmacology Toxicology and Pharmacy not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Pharmacology Toxicology and Pharmacy categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Pharmacy
node.hasNote: The study of the professional practice of pharmacy. Includes instruction in principles of medicinal chemistry drug behaviour and mixing preparing and dispensing of prescription medications.

node.label: Physiology
node.hasNote: The study of systemic function and behaviour of the human body including processes such as respiration circulation digestion excretion and reproduction.

node.label: Physiotherapy
node.hasNote: The study of the planning and execution of treatment programmes to prevent or remedy physical dysfunction relieve pain and prevent further disability.

node.label: Practice Nursing
node.hasNote: The vocational study of principles and techniques associated with a doctor's surgery.

node.label: Radiography diagnostic
node.hasNote: The study of the principles and techniques in the use of radiation to provide medical diagnostic information.

node.label: Radiography therapeutic
node.hasNote: The study of the treatment of human diseases by means of controlled exposure to forms of radiation.

node.label: Radiology
node.hasNote: The study of the principles and techniques in the use of radiation to provide diagnostic information and therapy in medicine.

node.label: Reflexology
node.hasNote: A system of massage through reflex points on the feet hands and head used to relieve tension and treat illness.

node.label: School Nursing
node.hasNote: The vocational study of principles and techniques for the provision of care within a school setting.

node.label: Speech Science
node.hasNote: The study of the anatomy and physiology of the human speech organs their function and malfunction and related environmental and behavioural topics.

node.label: Subjects Allied to Medicine not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Others in Subjects Allied to Medicine categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Toxicology
node.hasNote: The study of the nature source identification and characteristics of poisons toxic substances and exogenous chemical agents and their effects on human tissues and systems.

node.label: Applied Biological Sciences
node.hasNote: Topics in Other Biological Sciences of commercial or social importance.

node.label: Applied Biology
node.hasNote: Topics in Biology of commercial or social importance.

node.label: Applied Botany
node.hasNote: Topics in Botany of commercial or social importance.

node.label: Applied Cell Biology
node.hasNote: Topics in Cell Biology of commercial or social importance.

node.label: Applied Genetics
node.hasNote: Topics in genetics of commercial or social importance e.g. in animal and plant breeding.

node.label: Applied Microbiology
node.hasNote: Topics in microbiology of commercial or social importance.

node.label: Applied Molecular Biology Biophysics and Biochemistry
node.hasNote: Topics in Molecular Biology Biophysics and Biochemistry of commercial or social importance.

node.label: Applied Psychology
node.hasNote: The effect of human factors in psychological processes.

node.label: Applied Zoology
node.hasNote: Zoological topics of commercial or social importance e.g. animal disease and eradication.

node.label: Bacteriology
node.hasNote: The study of bacteria and bacterial diseases.

node.label: Behavioural Biology
node.hasNote: The study of biological factors of behaviour.

node.label: Biodiversity
node.hasNote: Concentrates on the design and development of different species and their interrelationships.

node.label: Biological Chemistry
node.hasNote: The study of the molecules and compounds that make up cells and organisms; how they are formed and how they interact. Includes the study of Molecular Biology.

node.label: Biological Sciences not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Others in Biological (or Life) Sciences categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Biology
node.hasNote: A broadly based scientific study of living organisms both animal and vegetable. Includes their structure functions evolution distribution and interrelationships.

node.label: Biology not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping which do not fit into the other Biology categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Biometry
node.hasNote: Concerned with the quantitative techniques and measurement in the biological Sciences.

node.label: Biomolecular Science
node.hasNote: The study of the molecular processes in the life sciences.

node.label: Biophysical Science
node.hasNote: The use of the methods of physical science in the biological sciences.

node.label: Biotechnology
node.hasNote: The molecular and microbial bio-organisms for processes such as fermentation and enzyme technology.

node.label: Botany
node.hasNote: The study of plants including their classification structure physiology ecology and economic importance. Includes the importance of plants for a balanced ecosystem including the process of energy fixation and conversion in to the biosphere (and thus with food and fuel). May also be called Plant Science.

node.label: Botany not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Botany categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Cell Biology
node.hasNote: Concerned with the organisation of the cell cell membrane and cell communication.

node.label: Cell Zoology
node.hasNote: Concerned with the cellular organisation and function in animals.

node.label: Clinical Psychology
node.hasNote: The study of psychological disorder.

node.label: Cognitive Psychology
node.hasNote: The scientific study of the mechanisms and processes associated with perception learning memory and thinking.

node.label: Developmental Biology
node.hasNote: The study of the development of multi-cellular organisms.

node.label: Developmental Psychology
node.hasNote: Concerned with behaviour viewed from a developmental perspective.

node.label: Developmental Zoology
node.hasNote: Development of animals in particular the differentiation of cells tissues and organs.

node.label: Developmental/Reproductive Biology
node.hasNote: The study of the development and reproduction of multi-cellular organisms and the differentiation of cells tissues and organs.

node.label: Ecology
node.hasNote: The study of organisms in their environment their interactions and history.

node.label: Educational Psychology
node.hasNote: The study and application of psychological processes involved in optimising learning and teaching.

node.label: Entomology
node.hasNote: The study of insects including their role as pests.

node.label: Environmental Biology
node.hasNote: Relates animals and plants to their terrestrial and marine habitats.

node.label: Evolution
node.hasNote: The study of organisms' adaptation to their environment and the mechanisms of heredity and change.

node.label: Experimental Psychology
node.hasNote: Scientific investigation into fundamental psychological processes.

node.label: Freshwater Biology
node.hasNote: The study of freshwater and estuarine biology.

node.label: Genetics
node.hasNote: The scientific study of origin heredity and variation in organisms; includes the inheritance of biological information.

node.label: Genetics not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Genetics categories. To be use sparingly.

node.label: Health Psychology
node.hasNote: The study of the maintenance of psychological well being.

node.label: Human Genetics
node.hasNote: The study of the genetics of the human species including chromosome theory and the mechanism of gene action.

node.label: Immunology
node.hasNote: The study of the immune system as a defence mechanism against infection.

node.label: Marine Biology
node.hasNote: The study of saltwater and oceanic biology.

node.label: Marine Zoology
node.hasNote: The biological study of animals in seawater environments.

node.label: Marine/Freshwater Biology
node.hasNote: The study of aquatic biology.

node.label: Medical Biochemistry
node.hasNote: Covers the biochemical aspects of metabolic processes in humans.

node.label: Medical Genetics
node.hasNote: The investigation of genetic abnormalities and their treatment in humans.

node.label: Medical Microbiology
node.hasNote: The study of the interactions between micro-organisms and their human hosts.

node.label: Medical and Veterinary Biochemistry
node.hasNote: The study of the molecular basis of health and illness.

node.label: Medical and Veterinary Genetics
node.hasNote: The investigation of genetic abnormalities and their treatment.

node.label: Medical and Veterinary Microbiology
node.hasNote: The study of the interactions between micro-organisms and their hosts.

node.label: Metabolic Biochemistry
node.hasNote: Covers the biochemical aspects of metabolic processes.

node.label: Microbiology
node.hasNote: The scientific study of micro-organisms encompassing major components of genetics and molecular biology. Includes bacteriology virology cell structure and function and may include some immunology.

node.label: Microbiology not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Microbiology categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Molecular Biology Biophysics and Biochemistry
node.hasNote: The scientific study of the chemical compounds and reactions occurring in the cells of living organisms including the molecular and biochemical analysis of life processes. Involves aspects of cellular organisation and specialisation and how the structure and function of DNA RNA proteins enzymes and membranes determine biological processes.

node.label: Molecular Biology Biophysics and Biochemistry not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Molecular Biology Biophysics and Biochemistry categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Molecular Genetics
node.hasNote: The study of genetic factors and processes at molecular level.

node.label: Mycology
node.hasNote: The study of fungi symbiotic relationships and their role in decay.

node.label: Neuropsychology
node.hasNote: The explanation of behaviour in physiological terms.

node.label: Occupational Psychology
node.hasNote: The application of human factors in psychology.

node.label: Others in Biological Sciences
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Biological or Life Sciences categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Parasitology
node.hasNote: The study of the transmission and control of parasitic diseases and their vectors.

node.label: Pest Science
node.hasNote: Concerned with vertebrate and invertebrate pests their roles as disease vectors and agents of damage and their control.

node.label: Plant Biochemistry
node.hasNote: Concerned with cellular processes in plants including the understanding of the expression of genetic information.

node.label: Plant Biotechnology
node.hasNote: Involves the molecular and microbial manipulation of plants.

node.label: Plant Cell Science
node.hasNote: Concerned with the cellular organisation and function in plants.

node.label: Plant Pathology
node.hasNote: Concerned with the diseases of plants and their treatments.

node.label: Population Biology
node.hasNote: The study of organism numbers and population dynamics.

node.label: Psychology
node.hasNote: Scientific enquiry into behavioural and mental processes. May include study of the brain and brainwaves sense and biological and physiological bases of behaviour.

node.label: Psychology not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Psychology categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Psychometrics
node.hasNote: Use of measurement and quantitative techniques in psychological testing.

node.label: Reproductive Biology
node.hasNote: The study of the reproduction of multi-cellular organisms.

node.label: Serology
node.hasNote: The study of sera and blood related products.

node.label: Social Psychology
node.hasNote: The study of the behaviour of individuals in society.

node.label: Sports Science
node.hasNote: The scientific study of the anatomy physiology biomechanics and psychology of the human body with a view to optimising performance in sporting activities.

node.label: Veterinary Biochemistry
node.hasNote: Covers the biochemical aspects of metabolic processes in animals.

node.label: Veterinary Genetics
node.hasNote: The investigation of genetic abnormalities and their treatment in animals.

node.label: Veterinary Microbiology
node.hasNote: The study of the interactions between micro-organisms and their animal hosts.

node.label: Virology
node.hasNote: The study of viruses and viral diseases.

node.label: Zoology
node.hasNote: The scientific study of all aspects of animal biology: their reproduction development physiology behaviour mechanics of locomotion diseases and interactions with the environment.

node.label: Zoology not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Zoology categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Veterinary Sciences Agriculture and related subjects
Agricultural Biochemistry
node.hasNote: The scientific study of the chemical compounds and reactions occurring in the cells and molecules of living organisms with particular emphasis on their use in or effect on agricultural processes. Involves aspects of cellular organisation and specialisation and how the structure and function of DNA RNA proteins enzymes and membranes determine biological processes.

node.label: Agricultural Biology
node.hasNote: A scientific study of living organisms both animal and vegetable with particular emphasis on their use in or effect on agricultural processes.

node.label: Agricultural Botany
node.hasNote: The particular study of plants cultivated as a crop. Includes their classification structure physiology ecology and economic importance.

node.label: Agricultural Chemistry
node.hasNote: The particular study of how individual atoms and molecules react together naturally and/or synthetically to affect agricultural processes.

node.label: Agricultural Irrigation and Drainage
node.hasNote: The study of the control of water by means of artificial canals and ditches mechanical pumps weather stations etc.

node.label: Agricultural Machinery
node.hasNote: The study of the use and maintenance of agricultural machinery. Includes the study of tractors hedge clippers milking machines etc.

node.label: Agricultural Microbiology
node.hasNote: The scientific study of micro-organisms encompassing major components of genetics and molecular biology with particular emphasis on their use in or effect on agricultural processes. Includes bacteriology virology cell structure and function and may include some immunology.

node.label: Agricultural Pests and Diseases
node.hasNote: The study of diseases in crops and the animals and insects which attack them with the object of preventing such disease or attack.

node.label: Agricultural Sciences
node.hasNote: The specifically scientific study of aspects of agriculture excluding wider non-laboratory based agricultural subjects such as economics business management and land-use.

node.label: Agricultural Sciences not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Agricultural Sciences categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Agricultural Technology
node.hasNote: The study of practical or mechanical sciences connected with agriculture as they apply to increased efficiency economy and crop production.

node.label: Agricultural Zoology
node.hasNote: The scientific study of all agriculture-related aspects of animal biology. Includes their reproduction development physiology behaviour diseases and interactions with their environment.

node.label: Agriculture
node.hasNote: The study of farming and husbandry conservation rural business studies and related applied sciences. Includes study and practical experience of cultivating land and rearing crops and livestock. May also include some aspects of rural recreation.

node.label: Agriculture not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Agriculture categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Amenity Plant Production
node.hasNote: The study of plants grown for their appearance.

node.label: Animal Anatomy
node.hasNote: The study of the physical structure of an animal how each part works and is related. Studies include dissection and use of microscope slides.

node.label: Animal Health
node.hasNote: The study of animal diseases with the object of prevention or diagnosis and cure.

node.label: Animal Nutrition
node.hasNote: The study of the process of assimilating nutrient materials into animal tissue.

node.label: Animal Pathology
node.hasNote: The study of the effect of disease and/or damage to the animal frame. Studies include dissection and use of microscope slides.

node.label: Animal Pharmacology
node.hasNote: The study of drugs their characteristics actions uses and effects on different animals.

node.label: Animal Pharmacy
node.hasNote: The study of the preparation and dispensing of animal-related drugs. Involves an understanding of the food-chain and its interaction with human beings.

node.label: Animal Physiology
node.hasNote: The study of systemic function and behaviour of the animal frame including processes such as respiration circulation digestion excretion and reproduction.

node.label: Animal Science
node.hasNote: The scientific study of animals their nutrition treatment and care. Includes the study of animals diseases and their cure. May include veterinary nursing. Also may include the study of drugs their characteristics actions and uses.

node.label: Animal Toxicology
node.hasNote: The study of poisons their nature effect on different animals and possible antidotes.

node.label: Animal Welfare
node.hasNote: The study of the health contentment and well-being of animals how such contentment should be maintained and the laws concerning animal housing and provision.

node.label: Aquaculture
node.hasNote: The study of the cultivation of water resources both plant and animal for human consumption or use.

node.label: Arable and Fruit Farming
node.hasNote: The study of the most efficient way to grow crops on a large scale including those borne on trees for food.

node.label: Cereal Science
node.hasNote: The study of the properties of cereal and grains. Includes the application of food sciences to cereal-inclusive food systems.

node.label: Clinical Veterinary Dentistry
node.hasNote: The observation diagnosis and treatment of illness disease or damage to the teeth and gums through direct interaction with non-human patients.

node.label: Clinical Veterinary Medicine
node.hasNote: The observation diagnosis and treatment of illness disease or damage through direct interaction with non-human patients.

node.label: Clinical Veterinary Medicine and Dentistry
node.hasNote: The observation diagnosis and treatment of illness disease or damage through direct interaction with non-human patients.

node.label: Clinical Veterinary Medicine and Dentistry not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Clinical Veterinary Medicine & Dentistry categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Community Forestry
node.hasNote: The study of forestry used for recreation. Includes study of formal and informal recreational uses erosion and damage to habitat from over or inappropriate use and the techniques to prevent cure and minimise such damage.

node.label: Crop Nutrition
node.hasNote: The study of the process of assimilating nutrient materials into crop tissue with the aim of understanding and providing the correct nutrient balance.

node.label: Crop Physiology
node.hasNote: The study of crop structure and how it is affected by disease. Studies include dissection and use of microscope slides. Also includes study at cellular level.

node.label: Crop Production
node.hasNote: The study of growing and harvesting crops and the relationship of arable production to its environment and humans.

node.label: Crop Protection
node.hasNote: The particular study of the development of immunities in crops. Also includes the study of artificial barriers preventatives or exterminators for the animals/insects which attack crops.

node.label: Environmental Conservation
node.hasNote: The study of the protection and careful management of natural resources and the environment.

node.label: Equine studies
node.hasNote: The particular study of horses their health livery and use as farm domestic and recreational animals.

node.label: Exotic Livestock
node.hasNote: The study of the most efficient way to keep rear and breed animals not native to Britain.

node.label: Exotic Plants and Crops
node.hasNote: The study of the most efficient way to plant sow and harvest non-native crops.

node.label: Farm Management
node.hasNote: The study of the most efficient way to keep livestock and grow and harvest crops and fruit. Includes home farm management.

node.label: Fish Farming
node.hasNote: The study of the most efficient way to use an area of water to rear fish for commercial sale.

node.label: Fish Husbandry
node.hasNote: The study of fish in their environment for fishing or fish farming.

node.label: Food Hygiene
node.hasNote: The study of the maintenance and promotion of health through the clean and sanitary handling of food.

node.label: Food Science
node.hasNote: The study of the properties and behaviour of food. Includes the application of physical chemical and biological sciences to food systems.

node.label: Food and Beverage Delivery
node.hasNote: The study of transportation of food and drink to ensure economic and hygienic handling and customer satisfaction.

node.label: Food and Beverage Manufacture
node.hasNote: The study of the development of artificial foodstuffs. Includes the substitution of one type of food for another.

node.label: Food and Beverage Processing
node.hasNote: The study of the preservation and processing of foodstuffs.

node.label: Food and Beverage Production
node.hasNote: The study of the process of supplying food and drink. Includes study of production techniques and the amount and rate at which foodstuffs are produced.

node.label: Food and Beverage Technology
node.hasNote: The study of production techniques for food and drink. Includes study of resources and environmental concerns.

node.label: Food and Beverage studies
node.hasNote: The study of the properties and behaviour of food from the point of origin on the farm (or elsewhere) through different stages of storage transportation preservation or other transformations including domestic or restaurant food preparation procedures to its use by the consumer.

node.label: Food and Beverages Packaging
node.hasNote: The study of packaging and packaging systems to ensure economic and hygienic handling and customer satisfaction.

node.label: Food and Beverages for the Consumer
node.hasNote: The study of food products and their preparation to attract consumers.

node.label: Food studies not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Food studies categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Forestry
node.hasNote: The study of the planting and caring for trees and the management of woods and forests for conservation purposes commercial exploitation and recreational use.

node.label: Forestry Irrigation and Drainage
node.hasNote: The study of the control of water and prevention of erosion by means of good planting mechanical pumps etc.

node.label: Forestry Pests and Diseases
node.hasNote: The study of diseases in commercially-grown hardwood and softwood trees and the animals and insects which attack them with the object of preventing such disease or attack.

node.label: Forestry Technology
node.hasNote: The study of practical or mechanical sciences connected with forestry as they apply to increased efficiency economy and crop production.

node.label: Forestry not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Forestry categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Freshwater Fish
node.hasNote: The study of fish generic to unsalted ponds streams rivers and lakes their habits breeding patterns and the unique effects of their environment.

node.label: Fruit Science
node.hasNote: The study of the properties of fruit. Includes the application of physical chemical and biological sciences to fruit-inclusive food systems.

node.label: Game keeping
node.hasNote: The study of the breeding maintenance and protection of wild animals preserved specifically for hunting purposes.

node.label: Gamekeeping Management
node.hasNote: The study of the habitat and management of land set aside for hunting purposes.

node.label: Glasshouse Culture
node.hasNote: The study of plant growth in greenhouse conditions.

node.label: Heritage Management
node.hasNote: The study of the conservation of land which has or contains something of rarity value. Includes the study of Sites of Special Scientific Interest sites of historical significance etc. May include maintenance and visitor management.

node.label: Industrial Baking
node.hasNote: The study of the production of cooked foodstuffs. Includes the application of physical chemical and biological sciences to food preparation.

node.label: Industrial Brewing
node.hasNote: The study of the production of liquid beverages. Includes the application of physical chemical and biological sciences to drink preparation.

node.label: International Agriculture
node.hasNote: The study of the science or occupation of cultivating land and rearing crops in various parts of the world.

node.label: International Forestry
node.hasNote: The study of the science or occupation of cultivating trees as a crop in various parts of the world.

node.label: Land Management for Recreation
node.hasNote: The study of land used for informal recreation. Includes study of erosion and damage to habitat from over or inappropriate use and the techniques to prevent cure and minimise such damage.

node.label: Livestock
node.hasNote: The study of the most efficient way to keep animals for agricultural use rather than as pets.

node.label: Livestock Husbandry
node.hasNote: The study of animals and their relationship with their environment and people in order to enable successful farming.

node.label: Meat Science
node.hasNote: The study of the properties of meat. Includes the application of food sciences to meat-inclusive food systems.

node.label: Organic Arable and Fruit Farming
node.hasNote: The study of the most efficient way to grow crops on a large scale including those borne on trees for food without the use of artificial chemicals or fertilisers.

node.label: Organic Farming
node.hasNote: The study of agricultural processes conducted without the use of artificial chemicals in the form of fertilisers or pesticides.

node.label: Organic Fish Farming
node.hasNote: The study of the most efficient way to use of an area of water to rear fish for commercial sale without the use of artificial chemicals.

node.label: Organic Forestry
node.hasNote: The study of forestry processes conducted without the use of artificial chemicals in the form of fertilisers or pesticides.

node.label: Organic Livestock
node.hasNote: The study of the most efficient way to keep animals for agricultural use rather than as pets without the use of artificial chemicals or feed.

node.label: Ornamental Fish
node.hasNote: The study of fish kept for recreational purposes their habits and breeding patterns.

node.label: Others in Veterinary Sciences Agriculture and related subjects
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Veterinary Sciences Agriculture and related subjects categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Overseas Veterinary Development
node.hasNote: The study of international veterinary practice and its development in specialist areas.

node.label: Poultry keeping
node.hasNote: The study of egg and fowl production and the relationship of poultry to its environment and people.

node.label: Pre-clinical Veterinary Medicine
node.hasNote: Vocational science concerned with the diagnosis and treatment of disease in animals.

node.label: Pre-clinical Veterinary Medicine not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Pre-clinical Veterinary Medicine categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Rural Estate Management
node.hasNote: The study of the administration of large landed properties as or on behalf of their owner. Includes elements of business studies personnel management buildings management.

node.label: Saltwater Fish
node.hasNote: The study of fish generic to seas oceans and salted estuaries their habits breeding patterns and the unique effects of their environment.

node.label: Soil as an Agricultural medium
node.hasNote: The study of the physical chemical and biological processes which explain soil behaviour.

node.label: Timber Production
node.hasNote: The study of hardwood and softwood timber products. May include the different uses of wood products. May also include the suitability of certain trees for certain uses.

node.label: Tree Nutrition
node.hasNote: The study of the process of assimilating nutrient materials into tree tissue with the aim of understanding and providing the correct balance.

node.label: Tree Physiology
node.hasNote: The study of hardwood and softwood tree structure and how it is affected by disease. Studies include dissection and use of microscope slides. Also includes study at cellular level.

node.label: Tree Production
node.hasNote: The study of growing and harvesting trees and the relationship of such tree production to its environment.

node.label: Tree Protection
node.hasNote: The particular study of the development of immunities in trees. Also includes the study of artificial barriers preventative measures or exterminators for the animals/insects which attack them.

node.label: Trees and Shrubs
node.hasNote: The study of the most efficient way to grow hardwood and softwood trees for harvesting.

node.label: Vegetable Science
node.hasNote: The study of the properties of vegetables. Includes the application of food sciences to vegetable-inclusive food systems.

node.label: Veterinary Nursing
node.hasNote: Vocational science concerning the practical care of sick injured and/or infirm animals.

node.label: Veterinary Public Health
node.hasNote: The study of the prevention of the spread of disease from animals to man.

node.label: Veterinary Sciences Agriculture and related subjects not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Others in Veterinary Sciences Agriculture and related subjects categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Veterinary Sciences not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Veterinary Sciences categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Water Resource Management
node.hasNote: The study of fresh and salt water its use commercially domestically and recreationally. Includes the conservation of water. Also includes the study of drought flood and the water cycle.

node.label: Wilderness Management
node.hasNote: The study of the conservation of wild uninhabited and uncultivated and for aesthetic recreational or scientific purposes.

node.label: Acoustics
node.hasNote: The study of the propagation and transmission of sound waves.

node.label: Analytical Chemistry
node.hasNote: The study of chemical and instrumental analysis.

node.label: Applied Chemistry
node.hasNote: Topics in chemistry of commercial or social importance.

node.label: Applied Environmental Sciences
node.hasNote: Topics in Environmental Sciences of industrial or commercial importance.

node.label: Applied Geology
node.hasNote: Topics in geology of commercial or social importance.

node.label: Applied Physics
node.hasNote: Topics in physics of commercial or social importance.

node.label: Archaeological Science
node.hasNote: Scientific analysis of the material remains of past cultures. Includes an approach to reconstruct and understand the past.

node.label: Astronomy
node.hasNote: The specifically scientific study of celestial bodies. Includes mathematics statistics physics photography and computing.

node.label: Astronomy not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Astronomy categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Astrophysics
node.hasNote: The study of the physical nature of the universe including cosmology and astronomical techniques.

node.label: Atmospheric Physics
node.hasNote: The study of the Earth's upper atmosphere.

node.label: Bio-organic Chemistry
node.hasNote: The study of natural organic compounds.

node.label: Biogeography
node.hasNote: The study of the geographical distribution of flora and fauna.

node.label: Biomolecular Chemistry
node.hasNote: The chemical science of biological materials at the molecular level.

node.label: Cartography
node.hasNote: The preparation and production of maps and/or charts.

node.label: Chemical Physics
node.hasNote: Concerned with central area of physical science integrating chemistry and physics.

node.label: Chemistry
node.hasNote: The study of individual atoms and molecules and the way they react together naturally and synthetically.

node.label: Chemistry not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Chemistry categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Climatology
node.hasNote: The study of secular weather conditions and climates.

node.label: Colour Chemistry
node.hasNote: The chemical science of dyes and pigments.

node.label: Computational Physics
node.hasNote: Numerical and quantitative methods in physics.

node.label: Crystallography
node.hasNote: The study and application of techniques for determining crystal structure.

node.label: Earth Science
node.hasNote: The study of the Earth as a unified system; includes Earth resources surface and crustal processes.

node.label: Electromagnetism
node.hasNote: The study of the interaction of charges in electromagnetic fields.

node.label: Engineering Geology
node.hasNote: Geological structures and processes in an engineering context.

node.label: Engineering Physics
node.hasNote: Physical principles and techniques applied to engineering and technology.

node.label: Environmental Chemistry
node.hasNote: Concerned with environmental issues related to the chemical sciences.

node.label: Environmental Geography
node.hasNote: The investigation of the relationship between natural and human environments.

node.label: Environmental Physics
node.hasNote: Aspects of physics concerned with environmental issues.

node.label: Environmental Sciences
node.hasNote: The study of the terrestrial aquatic and atmospheric environment and human interaction with it. May also be called Ecology.

node.label: Exploration Geology
node.hasNote: Aspects related to the exploration for mineral resources.

node.label: Exploration Geophysics
node.hasNote: Geophysical techniques concerned with the discovery of geological deposits.

node.label: Forensic Science
node.hasNote: The application of Forensic Science in evaluating evidence in courts of law. The techniques used include fingerprinting (both traditional and genetic) analysis of blood and poison samples ballistics etc.

node.label: Forensic Science not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Forensic Science categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Forensic and Archaeological Science
node.hasNote: The specifically scientific study of materials involved in investigative procedures. May necessitate the study of chemical processes and other scientific techniques including archaeological sciences.

node.label: Geochemistry
node.hasNote: The study of the chemical processes taking place at or near the Earth's surface.

node.label: Geographical Information Systems
node.hasNote: The collection and transmission of geographical data using information technology.

node.label: Geographical and Environmental Sciences not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Geographical and Environmental Sciences categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Geological Oceanography
node.hasNote: The study of the sedimentary processes including deposition and dynamics in the oceans.

node.label: Geology
node.hasNote: The study of the origin history structure and composition of the Earth. Encourages understanding of environmental problems and includes techniques on searching for mineral resources and other raw materials.

node.label: Geology not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Geology categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Geomorphology
node.hasNote: The study of the processes determining the topography of the Earth's crust.

node.label: Geophysics
node.hasNote: The study of the physical structure and dynamics of the Earth.

node.label: Geoscience
node.hasNote: The study of the Earth Sciences including geological chemistry and physics.

node.label: Geotechnology
node.hasNote: The study of the principles and applications of geotechnical engineering.

node.label: Hydrography
node.hasNote: The collection and application of data about the sea including surveying and the study of tides and currents.

node.label: Hydrology
node.hasNote: The study of bodies of water their distribution and water resources.

node.label: Industrial Chemistry
node.hasNote: The study of chemical processes of industrial significance.

node.label: Industrial Geology
node.hasNote: The study of geological processes of industrial significance.

node.label: Inorganic Chemistry
node.hasNote: The study of inorganic elements compounds and reaction mechanisms.

node.label: Laser Physics
node.hasNote: The study of lasers as optical instrumentation.

node.label: Marine Chemistry
node.hasNote: Topics in the chemical sciences concerned with understanding the marine environment.

node.label: Marine Geotechnology
node.hasNote: The study of geotechnical processes in marine environments.

node.label: Marine Physics
node.hasNote: The study of the physical properties of the marine environment.

node.label: Marine Sciences
node.hasNote: The study of the coastal environment and mariculture.

node.label: Maritime Geography
node.hasNote: The geographical study of coastal and marine regions.

node.label: Materials Science
node.hasNote: The study of the crystalline and granular structure of materials including electronic atomic and molecular configurations. May include the study of mining and mining techniques.

node.label: Materials Science not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Materials Science categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Mathematical & Theoretical Physics
node.hasNote: The mathematical principles and techniques of physics theory and explanation of physical phenomena.

node.label: Medical Physics
node.hasNote: The application of physics to the medical sciences.

node.label: Medicinal Chemistry
node.hasNote: Aspects of chemistry such as drug design of importance to medical science.

node.label: Meteorology
node.hasNote: The study of atmospheric conditions related to weather conditions and forecasting.

node.label: Mining Geology
node.hasNote: Geological topics related to the mining and minerals industry.

node.label: Nuclear and Particle Physics
node.hasNote: The study of matter at atomic and sub-atomic level and of the structure and behaviour of nuclei.

node.label: Ocean Sciences
node.hasNote: The study of oceans the seabed and atmosphere. Includes oceanography. May include studies associated with physics chemistry geology and biology.

node.label: Ocean Sciences not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Ocean Sciences categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Optical Physics
node.hasNote: The study of optics as a natural phenomenon and optical instrumentation.

node.label: Organic Chemistry
node.hasNote: The study of organic compounds and their reaction mechanisms.

node.label: Organometallic Chemistry
node.hasNote: The study of reactions between organic compounds and metals.

node.label: Others in Physical Sciences
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Physical Sciences categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Palaeontology
node.hasNote: The study of the fossil record.

node.label: Petrochemical Chemistry
node.hasNote: The chemical science of petroleum and petroleum compounds.

node.label: Pharmaceutical Chemistry
node.hasNote: The study of drug function.

node.label: Physical Chemistry
node.hasNote: The study of atomic and molecular structure chemical bonding energetics and dynamics.

node.label: Physical Geography
node.hasNote: The study of the physical processes underlying the features of the Earth's surface.

node.label: Physical Sciences not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Others in Physical Sciences categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Physical and Terrestrial Geographical and Environmental Sciences
node.hasNote: The study of the natural features of the earth's surface and environmental interactions including topology climate soil and vegetation.

node.label: Physics
node.hasNote: The study of the properties of matter and energy and the relationships between them making extensive use of mathematical techniques and models. May include mechanics optics electricity magnetism and acoustics. May also include atomic nuclear particle and solid state studies.

node.label: Physics not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Physics categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Planetary Science
node.hasNote: The physical science study of the solar system.

node.label: Pollution Control
node.hasNote: The study of monitoring with the intention to reduce the emission and distribution of noxious substances in the environment.

node.label: Polymer Chemistry
node.hasNote: The study of the properties of macromolecular compounds and their synthesis.

node.label: Quantum Mechanics
node.hasNote: Description and analysis of sub-atomic behaviour.

node.label: Quaternary studies
node.hasNote: The study of the rock systems of the most recent geological period.

node.label: Radiation Physics
node.hasNote: Monitoring and evaluation of emissions from sources of radiation.

node.label: Remote Sensing
node.hasNote: Topographic and geomatic data surveying carried out over a distance.

node.label: Soil Science
node.hasNote: The study of the properties of soils and the processes involved in their formation and distribution.

node.label: Solid state Physics
node.hasNote: Study of the structure of solids and the explanation of their properties.

node.label: Space Science
node.hasNote: The physical science study of space beyond the solar system.

node.label: Space and Planetary Sciences
node.hasNote: The study of the solar system and evaluation of physical measurements from space.

node.label: Structural Chemistry
node.hasNote: Determination and analysis of chemical structures.

node.label: Topography
node.hasNote: The description of the Earth's surface features and their mapping and surveying.

node.label: Applied Mathematics
node.hasNote: The application of mathematical principles to the solution of functional area problems.

node.label: Applied Statistics
node.hasNote: The application of statistical techniques to functional areas.

node.label: Artificial Intelligence
node.hasNote: The study of principles and techniques for the computer-based simulation and modelling of intelligent animal behaviour patterns.

node.label: Artificial Intelligence not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Artificial Intelligence categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Automated Reasoning
node.hasNote: The study and development of techniques whereby machines may draw conclusions from facts and experience.

node.label: Cognitive Modelling
node.hasNote: The study and development of the processes involved in acquiring knowledge.

node.label: Computational Science Foundations
node.hasNote: The study of the fundamental laws or principles underpinning the design construction and use of computer systems.

node.label: Computer Architectures
node.hasNote: The study of the systemic structure of computer systems.

node.label: Computer Architectures & Operating Systems
node.hasNote: The study of the systemic structure of computer systems and the associated software which facilitates the efficient co-ordination and use of the component units.

node.label: Computer Science
node.hasNote: The study of the design and application of electronic computer systems including computer architectures software and systems design.

node.label: Computer Vision
node.hasNote: The study and development of digital image perception.

node.label: Computing Science not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Computing Science categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Data Management
node.hasNote: The management of computer systems which capture process and transmit data.

node.label: Databases
node.hasNote: The study design or application of information systems which act as structured repositories for large amounts of information.

node.label: Declarative Programming
node.hasNote: Programming using declarative programming languages e.g. Prolog Miranda.

node.label: Engineering/Industrial Mathematics
node.hasNote: Branch of mathematics concerned with the application of mathematical principles in the areas of engineering and industrial systems/processes.

node.label: Human-computer Interaction
node.hasNote: The study design and application of principles and techniques aimed at optimising the interaction between computer systems and their human users.

node.label: Information Modelling
node.hasNote: Concerned with the modelling of information flows within an organisation and how these flows can be optimised and incorporated into the design of a large-scale computer system.

node.label: Information Systems
node.hasNote: The study design or application of computers systems which capture process and transmit information.

node.label: Knowledge Representation
node.hasNote: Concerned with principles and methodologies for the capture representation storage and application of human knowledge in a computer system.

node.label: Machine Learning
node.hasNote: The study and development of techniques whereby machines may gain knowledge through experience deduction or reasoning.

node.label: Mathematical Methods
node.hasNote: The study of specific techniques for the precise solution of mathematical problems.

node.label: Mathematical Modelling
node.hasNote: The use of mathematical principles to construct simplified representations and simulations of 'real-world' processes allowing calculations and predictions to be made.

node.label: Mathematical Statistics
node.hasNote: Concerned with the mathematical theory and proofs forming the basis of probability and inference and their applications to the collection analysis and description of data.

node.label: Mathematical and Computing Sciences not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Others in Mathematical and Computing Sciences categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Mathematics
node.hasNote: The rigorous analysis of quantities magnitudes forms and their relationships using symbolic logic and language both in its own right and as applied to other disciplines.

node.label: Mathematics not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Mathematics categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Mechanics (Mathematical)
node.hasNote: Branch of applied mathematics concerned with motion and the tendency to motion.

node.label: Medical Statistics
node.hasNote: The application of statistical techniques to the collection and analysis of numerical data relating to medicine.

node.label: Multi-media Computing Science
node.hasNote: Area of Computer Science concerned with the computer controlled delivery of information in a variety of forms including text pictures video graphics and animation. Often associated with information presentation on the Internet.

node.label: Networks and Communications
node.hasNote: The study of computer network systems and computer communications techniques/protocols.

node.label: Neural Computing
node.hasNote: The study of computer-based hardware and software constructs which aim to model and simulate the salient features of animal nervous systems.

node.label: Numerical Analysis
node.hasNote: The study of the mathematical methods used to obtain approximate (numerical) results to a problem on a digital computer.

node.label: Object Oriented Programming
node.hasNote: Programming using object oriented programming languages and environments.

node.label: Operating Systems
node.hasNote: The study of software which is designed to facilitate the efficient coordination and use of system components.

node.label: Operational Research
node.hasNote: The development and application of complex mathematical or simulation models to solve problems involving operational systems where the system concerned is subject to human intervention.

node.label: Operational Research not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Operational Research categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Others in Computing Sciences
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related computing subjects which do not fit into other Computing Sciences categories G4 to G7.

node.label: Others in Mathematical Sciences
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related mathetical subjects which do not fit into other Mathematical Sciences categories G1 to G3.

node.label: Others in Mathematical and Computing Sciences
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Mathematical and Computing Sciences categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Probability
node.hasNote: The mathematical study of chance.

node.label: Procedural Programming
node.hasNote: Programming using procedural computer languages and environments e.g. Pascal Fortran Cobol.

node.label: Programming
node.hasNote: Concerned with the conversion of designs into computer instruction sets in order to satisfy the requirements of specific operational problems.

node.label: Pure Mathematics
node.hasNote: The rigorous analysis of quantities magnitudes forms and their relationships using symbolic logic and language.

node.label: Software Design
node.hasNote: Concerned with the design of computer instruction sets to satisfy the requirements of specific operational problems.

node.label: Software Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of techniques and principles for the design construction testing and maintenance of computer programs to satisfy the requirements of specific operational problems.

node.label: Software Engineering not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Software Engineering categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Speech and Natural Language Processing
node.hasNote: The study of principles and techniques for the computer-based modelling and simulation of the human use of language.

node.label: Statistical Modelling
node.hasNote: The use of statistical techniques in the modelling and simulation of 'real-world' systems or processes.

node.label: Statistics
node.hasNote: The study of the collection and analysis of numerical data.

node.label: Statistics not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Statistics categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Stochastic Processes
node.hasNote: The mathematical study of systems and processes involving variables subject to random variations.

node.label: Systems Analysis and Design
node.hasNote: The study of the principles and techniques for the design and implementation of large-scale computer systems.

node.label: Systems Analysis and Design not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Systems Analysis and Design categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Systems Auditing
node.hasNote: The study and development of techniques for inspecting correcting and verifying information systems.

node.label: Systems Design Methodologies
node.hasNote: The study of standard methodologies for the design of large-scale computer systems.

node.label: Acoustics
node.hasNote: The study of sound and sound waves.

node.label: Acoustics and Vibration
node.hasNote: The study of oscillation and resonance.

node.label: Aerodynamics
node.hasNote: The study of the flow properties of gases especially the forces acting on a body passing through air and the interaction of the body's deformation with the flow. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Aeronautical Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the design production and maintenance of aircraft. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Aerospace Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to aircraft and spacecraft in the atmosphere and in space. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Aerospace Engineering not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Aerospace Engineering categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Air-Combat Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the design production and maintenance of combat aircraft. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Air-Freight Transport Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the design production and maintenance of freight-carrying aircraft. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Air-Passenger Transport Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the design production and maintenance of passenger-carrying aircraft. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Analogue Circuit Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to voltages or currents used to measure or represent quantities.

node.label: Astronautical Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the design production and maintenance of spacecraft. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Atomic Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to industrial use and development of atoms and atomic energy.

node.label: Automated Engineering Design
node.hasNote: The study and development of the use of computers with particular application to engineering development and design. Includes aspects of software design and programming skills.

node.label: Automotive Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of mechanical self propulsion in vehicles.

node.label: Aviation studies
node.hasNote: The study of the technical aspects of flying and navigation.

node.label: Avionics
node.hasNote: The study of electronics as applied to aeronautics and astronautics. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Biochemical Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to industrial production of organic chemical compounds such as proteins and enzymes.

node.label: Bioengineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the design and manufacture of aids such as artificial limbs to rectify defective body functions.

node.label: Bioprocess Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to biological processes in industry.

node.label: Broadcast Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the equipment required to transmit audio or video information for radio and/or television programmes.

node.label: Chemical Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to industrial processing to produce food pharmaceuticals plastics petroleum products etc. and alternatives to them.

node.label: Chemical Process Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to industrial processes particularly continuous ones such as the production of petrochemicals.

node.label: Chemical Process and Energy Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the industrial use and exploitation of chemical and atomic energy.

node.label: Chemical Process and Energy Engineering not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Chemical Process and Energy Engineering categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Civil Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the designing and construction of public works e.g. buildings bridges pipelines etc. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Civil Engineering not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Civil Engineering categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Coastal Decay
node.hasNote: The study and principles of engineering as they apply to coastal and off-shore structures and the prevention of damage decay and erosion to the natural environment. Includes the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Communications Engineering
node.hasNote: The study and principles of engineering as they apply to electronic engineering.

node.label: Computer-Aided Engineering
node.hasNote: The study and development of the use of computers with particular application to engineering problems. Includes aspects of software design and programming skills.

node.label: Control Systems
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to electrical and electronic methods of measurement regulation and operation.

node.label: Control by light systems
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the manipulation of tools by visible electromagnetic radiation.

node.label: Cybernetics
node.hasNote: The study of control systems in electronic and mechanical devices and the extent to which comparisons can be made between man-made and biological systems.

node.label: Digital Circuit Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to discrete values of input and output voltage levels.

node.label: Dynamics
node.hasNote: The study of the forces that change or produce the motion of bodies. May include the study of kinetics. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Electrical Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the practical uses of electrical systems. Involves the study of charged particles. Closely linked with electronic engineering.

node.label: Electrical Power
node.hasNote: The study of the rates at which electrical energy is fed into or taken from a device or system. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Electrical Power Distribution
node.hasNote: The study and development of electromotive forces and techniques for distributing electricity.

node.label: Electrical Power Generation
node.hasNote: The study and development of techniques for producing electricity.

node.label: Electromechanical Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of electrically-operated mechanical devices.

node.label: Electronic Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to devices whereby electrons are conducted through a semi-conductor free space or gas. Closely linked with electrical engineering.

node.label: Electronic and Electrical Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the practical uses of electricity. Involves the study of charged particles.

node.label: Electronic and Electrical Engineering not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Electronic and Electrical Engineering categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Energy Resources
node.hasNote: The study and principles of engineering as they apply to the development and exploitation of various forms of energy e.g. wind water solar etc. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Engineering Design
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the development of electronic or manufacturing engineering tools.

node.label: Engineering Surveying
node.hasNote: The study and practice of measuring altitudes angles and distances on the land surface in order to plan sites and constructions. Includes specialist underwater surveying techniques.

node.label: Engineering not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Others in Engineering categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Environmental Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the sympathetic use of natural resources.

node.label: Environmental Impact Assessment
node.hasNote: The study and principles of engineering as they apply to the assessment and repair of insensitive environmental exploitation or natural upheaval.

node.label: Fire Safety Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of engineering structures and the development and use of materials with particular emphasis on preventing injury or damage through fire.

node.label: Flight Mechanics
node.hasNote: The study of natural or constructed bodies in flight; how they are affected and influenced by forces outside them. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Fluid Mechanics
node.hasNote: The study of the mechanical and flow properties of fluids. May also be called Fluid Dynamics Hydraulics or Hydrodynamics. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Gas Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to gases and their production and use.

node.label: General Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of design construction maintenance and development of any device which uses the resources of nature to turn energy into productive and useful work.

node.label: General Engineering not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other General Engineering categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: General Practice Surveying
node.hasNote: The study and practice of measuring altitudes angles and distances on the land surface in order to discover the land contours and plot constructions accordingly.

node.label: Geotechnical Engineering
node.hasNote: The study and practice of discovering the formation arrangement and structure of the rocks of the earth's crust by means of sonic investigation. Includes the design of earth structures e.g. dams and foundations of build structures.

node.label: Instrumentation Control
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the electronic manipulation of tools.

node.label: Integrated Circuit Design
node.hasNote: The study of the most efficient processing of semiconductor material to form integrated circuits.

node.label: Integrated Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of different branches of engineering and how they may interrelate.

node.label: Manufacturing Installation Systems
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the design and installation of production-line technology.

node.label: Manufacturing Systems Design
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the design of new and/or replacement production-line technology.

node.label: Manufacturing Systems Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to electrical and electronic methods of manufacture.

node.label: Manufacturing Systems Maintenance
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the maintenance of production-line technology.

node.label: Mechanical Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the design development manufacture and operation of machinery.

node.label: Mechanical Engineering not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous group for related subjects which do not fit into other Mechanical Engineering categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Mechanics
node.hasNote: The study of the equilibrium of bodies or their motion within a particular frame of reference. May also be called Stress Analysis.

node.label: Mechanisms and Machines
node.hasNote: The study of the assembly and structure of moving parts arranged to transmit or modify force in order to perform some function.

node.label: Mechatronics
node.hasNote: The study of electronics as applied to the development of symbiotic software/hardware technology.

node.label: Microelectronic Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to microcircuits.

node.label: Microwave Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to electromagnetic radiation or very short length radio waves used for transmitting and collecting information.

node.label: Naval Architecture
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to ships and their reaction to water and its pressures. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Naval Architecture not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Naval Architecture categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Nuclear Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to industrial use and development of nuclear energy.

node.label: Offshore Engineering
node.hasNote: The study and principles of engineering as they apply to the construction of structures sited in the sea and their interaction with wind and waves. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Optoelectronic Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to devices in which an optical input produces and electrical output or in which electrical stimulation produces visible ultraviolet or infrared output.

node.label: Others in Engineering
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Engineering categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Pavement Engineering
node.hasNote: The study and principles of engineering as they apply to the planning development and construction of the routes for road transport.

node.label: Permanent Way Engineering
