node.hasNote: The study and principles of engineering as they apply to the planning development and construction of the routes for rail transport.

node.label: Petroleum Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the extraction processing and refining of petroleum.

node.label: Pharmaceutical Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to industrial preparation of drugs.

node.label: Production Processes
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to efficient application of production-line technology.

node.label: Production and Manufacturing Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the management and control of factory and workshop techniques and the industrial developments in technology and materials.

node.label: Production and Manufacturing Engineering not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Production and Manufacturing Engineering categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Propulsion Systems
node.hasNote: The study of aerospace locomotion and its driving force. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Public Health Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of engineering principles design and construction with particular emphasis on public health and safety.

node.label: Quality Assurance Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the creation of models from which conclusions about real situations can be researched.

node.label: Rail Vehicle Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of mechanical self propulsion in rail vehicles.

node.label: Road Vehicle Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of mechanical self propulsion in road vehicles.

node.label: Robotics
node.hasNote: The study of designing building and use of robots.

node.label: Robotics and Cybernetics
node.hasNote: The study of the relationship between biological systems and man-made systems designed and created to mimic them.

node.label: Safety Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of engineering structures and the development and use of materials with particular emphasis on preventing injury or sickness.

node.label: Satellite Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to man-made devices orbiting the earth for communication purposes.

node.label: Ship Design
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the design of floating vessels. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Ship Propulsion Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of mechanical self propulsion in floating vessels.

node.label: Shipbuilding
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the production and maintenance of ships and boats. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Solid Mechanics
node.hasNote: The study of the mechanical and static properties of solids. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Structural Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the design and construction of physical shapes and forms. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Structural Mechanics
node.hasNote: The study of the equilibrium and motion of structures either of themselves or influenced by forces outside them. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Submarine Building
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the production and maintenance of ships which float on or under the surface of the water. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Submarine Design
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the design of ships which float on or under the surface of the water. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Surface Combat Ship Building
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the production and maintenance of combat ships which float on or above the surface of the water. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Surface Combat Ship Design
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the design of combat ships which float on or above the surface of the water. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Surface Freight Ship Building
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the production and maintenance of freight-carrying ships which float on or above the surface of the water. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Surface Freight Ship Design
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the design of freight-carrying ships which float on or above the surface of the water. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Surface Passenger Ship Building
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the production and maintenance of passenger-carrying ships which float on or above the surface of the water. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Surface Passenger Ship Design
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the design of passenger-carrying ships which float on or above the surface of the water. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Surveying Science
node.hasNote: The study and practice of measuring altitudes angles and distances on the land surface so that they can be accurately plotted on a map. May include the use of satellite information. Includes the setting out on the ground the positions of proposed structures.

node.label: Systems Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to an assembly of electrical electronic and mechanical components with interdependent functions.

node.label: Telecommunications Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to the telephonic or telegraphic communication of audio video or other information (e.g. data) by means of radio waves optical or electrical signals.

node.label: Thermodynamics
node.hasNote: The study of the interrelationship and interconversion of different forms of energy. Includes the study of the effects of pressure temperature etc. May also be called Heat Exchange Technology. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Transport Engineering
node.hasNote: The study and principles of engineering as they apply to the planning development and construction of the routes for any form of terrestrial transport.

node.label: Turbine Technology
node.hasNote: The study of the conversion of the kinetic energy of a moving fluid via a rotating blade into mechanical energy. Involves the study and application of specialist mathematics.

node.label: Vibration
node.hasNote: The study of periodic motion about an equilibrium position.

node.label: Virtual Reality Engineering
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of engineering as they apply to computer-generated environments.

node.label: Water Quality Control
node.hasNote: The study of engineering structures and fluid mechanics with particular emphasis on improving and maintaining water supplies and the disposal of waste water. May include considerations of health hygiene and recreational use.

node.label: Applied Metallurgy
node.hasNote: Topics in metallurgy of commercial or social importance.

node.label: Audio Technology
node.hasNote: The study of the systems and processes used in the manipulation and amplification of sound. Includes the recording of sound and/or music.

node.label: Ceramics
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of minerals technology as they apply to ceramics. Stresses the use of the raw material rather than how it is extracted.

node.label: Ceramics and Glasses
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of minerals technology as they apply to clay and clay-based products. Stresses the use of the raw material rather than how it is extracted.

node.label: Ceramics and Glasses not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Ceramics and Glass categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Clothing Production
node.hasNote: The study of the methods and processes used in the production of clothing.

node.label: Commercial Tailoring
node.hasNote: The making and adaptation of clothing to specific measurements.

node.label: Corrosion Technology
node.hasNote: The study and control of the corrosion of metals.

node.label: Dying and Colouring of Textiles
node.hasNote: The study of dying and colouring agents and their application to textiles.

node.label: Energy Technologies
node.hasNote: Technologies involved in the production transmission and storage of energy.

node.label: Engineering Materials
node.hasNote: The processing storage and production of materials used in engineering.

node.label: Ergonomics
node.hasNote: The study of the efficiency and effectiveness of the interface between people and machines.

node.label: Footwear production
node.hasNote: The design and production of footwear.

node.label: Furniture Technology
node.hasNote: The processing storage and production of materials used in furniture making.

node.label: Gemmology
node.hasNote: The processing cutting and polishing of precious stones.

node.label: Glass Technology
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of minerals technology as they apply to glass and glass derivatives. Stresses the use of the raw material rather than how it is extracted.

node.label: Industrial Biotechnology
node.hasNote: The study of micro-organisms e.g. bacteria and their use within industry.

node.label: Industrial Biotechnology not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Industrial Biotechnology categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Industrial Machinery Maintenance
node.hasNote: The techniques and skills involved in the routine maintenance of industrial machinery.

node.label: Leather Technology
node.hasNote: The study of the processing and use of leather. Includes tanning and methods of preserving leather.

node.label: Machine Knitting
node.hasNote: The study of the programming and operation of knitting machines.

node.label: Machinery Maintenance
node.hasNote: The techniques and skills involved in the routine maintenance of machines.

node.label: Marine Navigation
node.hasNote: The study of the specific processes involved in marine navigation.

node.label: Marine Plumbing
node.hasNote: The use of plumbing systems in boats ships and other marine craft.

node.label: Marine Radar
node.hasNote: The use of radar in boats ships and other marine craft.

node.label: Marine Radio
node.hasNote: The use of radio and telecommunications systems in boats ships and other marine craft.

node.label: Marine Technology
node.hasNote: The processes and systems used in boats ships and other marine craft.

node.label: Maritime Technology

node.label: Maritime Technology not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Maritime Technology categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Materials Technology
node.hasNote: The processing storage and production of materials.

node.label: Materials Technology not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other specified Materials Technology categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Materials Technology not otherwise specified
node.hasNote: Grouping for any materials or materials-related technology which does not fit into the other Material Technology categories.

node.label: Metallic Fabrication
node.hasNote: The processes involved in the production and manufacture of metallic objects and structures.

node.label: Metallurgy
node.hasNote: The study of the principles of minerals technology as they apply to the structure and properties of metals their extraction refining alloys and manufacture. Involves practical element.

node.label: Metallurgy not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Metallurgy categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Millinery
node.hasNote: The design and production of hats.

node.label: Mineral Processing
node.hasNote: The processing of minerals and metals from their raw or ore states.

node.label: Minerals Surveying

node.label: Minerals Technology

node.label: Minerals Technology not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Mineral Technology categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Mining

node.label: Music Recording
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the techniques required to obtain accurate and lifelike recordings of musical performances.

node.label: Musical Instrument Technology
node.hasNote: The study of the systems and processes used in the manufacture of musical instruments.

node.label: Office Machinery Maintenance
node.hasNote: The techniques and skills involved in the routine maintenance of office machinery.

node.label: Offset Lithography
node.hasNote: The study of the processes involved in offset lithographic printing.

node.label: Others in Technology
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Technology categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Paper Technology

node.label: Pattern Cutting

node.label: Pattern Making

node.label: Petrochemical Technology

node.label: Photo-Lithography
node.hasNote: The study of the processes involved in photo-lithography.

node.label: Plastics

node.label: Polymers Technology
node.hasNote: The use and development of polymers.

node.hasNote: The study of molecular compounds or filaments. Stresses the uses of the raw material rather than how it is extracted.

node.label: Polymers and Textiles not elsewhere classified

node.label: Printing
node.hasNote: The study of the processes involved in printing.

node.label: Quarrying
node.hasNote: The study of the extraction and processing of stone.

node.label: Reprographic Techniques
node.hasNote: The study of the processes involved in reprographics.

node.label: Rock Mechanics

node.label: Screen Process Printing

node.label: Tanning

node.label: Textiles Technology

node.label: Architectural Technology

node.label: Architecture Building and Planning not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Others in Architecture Building and Planning categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Architecture not elsewhere classified

node.label: Building

node.label: Planning (Urban Rural and Regional) not elsewhere classified

node.label: Quantity Surveying

node.label: Regional Planning

node.label: Rural Planning

node.label: Transport Planning
node.hasNote: The development and management of transportation systems.

node.label: Urban Planning

node.label: Urban and Rural Planning

node.label: Urban studies

node.label: Agricultural Economics

node.label: Agricultural Geography

node.label: Anarchism

node.label: Anthropology

node.label: Anthropology not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Anthropology categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Applied Sociology
node.hasNote: The study of the application of sociological principles and techniques to particular social institutions or types of social relationship.

node.label: Autocracy

node.label: Capitalism

node.label: Careers Guidance

node.label: Child Care

node.label: Collectivism

node.label: Commonwealth Politics
node.hasNote: The study of the structures functions and theories of politics within the Commonwealth.

node.label: Community Work

node.label: Comparative Politics

node.label: Conservatism

node.label: Cultural Geography

node.label: Democracy

node.label: Disability in Society
node.hasNote: The study of the sociological influence of disability.

node.label: Econometrics

node.label: Economic Geography

node.label: Economic Policy

node.label: Economic Systems
node.hasNote: The study of economic systems based upon particular doctrines.

node.label: Economics

node.label: Economics not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Economic categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Education Policy
node.hasNote: The study of policies implemented by local and central governments to provide for the educational needs of society.

node.label: Environmentalism
node.hasNote: Political doctrine that believes that human life can only be understood in the context of the natural world and that progress lies in the preservation of the natural environment.

node.label: Ethnic studies
node.hasNote: The study of the sociological influence of ethnicity.

node.label: European Union Politics
node.hasNote: The study of the structures functions and theories of politics within the European Union.

node.label: Fascism
node.hasNote: Political doctrine that emphasises the dominance and the hierarchical authoritarian organisation of the state.

node.label: Feminism
node.hasNote: Political doctrine that highlights and attempts to reverse any inequalities in society based on gender differences.

node.label: Financial Economics
node.hasNote: The study of the application of economic principles and analytical techniques in the area of finance.

node.label: Gender studies
node.hasNote: The study of the sociological influence of gender.

node.label: Health & Welfare

node.label: Health Policy

node.label: Historical Geography

node.label: Human and Social Geography

node.label: Macroeconomics

node.label: Men's Studies

node.label: Social studies not elsewhere classified

node.label: Sociology

node.label: Classical Greek studies not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Classical Greek studies categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Classical studies not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Classical studies categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: English studies not elsewhere classified

node.hasNote: The study of the structure development spread and acquisition of the languages of the French-speaking peoples.

node.label: German Linguistics
node.hasNote: The study of the structure development spread and acquisition of the languages of the German-speaking peoples.

node.hasNote: The study of the structure development spread and acquisition of the languages of the Italian-speaking peoples.

node.label: Japanese Linguistics

node.label: Latin studies
node.hasNote: The study of Latin its structure history grammar and use. May involve investigation into its relationship with modern day speech and language. May also involve the study of literature texts using the techniques of literary analysis and interpretation.

node.label: Latin studies not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Latin studies categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Linguistics
node.hasNote: The study of the nature of language its development and acquisition. May involve some study of human vocal anatomy.

node.label: Linguistics Classics and related subjects not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Others in Linguistics Classics and related subjects categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Linguistics of African Languages
node.hasNote: The study of the structure development spread and acquisition of the languages of the African peoples.

node.hasNote: The study of the structure development spread and acquisition of Ancient and/or Classical languages.

node.label: Linguistics of Middle-Eastern Languages
node.hasNote: The study of the structure development spread and acquisition of the languages of Middle-Eastern peoples.

node.label: Literature in its original language
node.hasNote: The study analysis and interpretation of literature written in a language other than English.

node.label: Literature in translation
node.hasNote: The study analysis and interpretation of literature translated into a language other than the one in which it was originally written.

node.label: Manx
node.hasNote: The study of the history grammar and use of Manx. Includes acquisition pronunciation and articulation.

node.label: Manx Literature
node.hasNote: The study of literature originally written in Manx. Includes the use of techniques of literary analysis and interpretation.

node.label: Medieval Latin
node.hasNote: The study of the history and grammar of vernacular Latin used in legal documents and how it differs from standard Latin. Includes acquisition and individual written forms.

node.label: Modern Celtic studies
node.hasNote: The study of modern Celtic culture and its literature using the techniques of literary analysis and interpretation. Involves language study and/or comparison between languages.

node.label: Others in Linguistics Classics and related subjects
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Linguistics Classics and related subjects categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Phonetics
node.hasNote: The study of speech processes including the production perception and analysis of speech sound. Includes speech acoustics anatomy and physiology.

node.label: Phonetics and Phonology
node.hasNote: The study of speech and language from the point of view of sound analysis.

node.label: Phonology
node.hasNote: The study of the sound systems of languages.

node.label: Prakrit
node.hasNote: The study of the structure semantics and cultural significance of the ancient vernacular language of India.

node.label: Psycholinguistics
node.hasNote: The study of cognition and the effects of psychology on linguistic understanding and ability.

node.label: Russian Linguistics
node.hasNote: The study of the structure development spread and acquisition of the languages of the Russian-speaking peoples.

node.label: Sanskrit
node.hasNote: The study of the structure semantics and cultural significance of the oldest recorded branch of the Indic branch of the Indo-European ancient language of India.

node.label: Sociolinguistics

node.hasNote: The interpretation of the underlying processes of change in society. Includes the study of the growth and development of societies in history.

node.label: Social Philosophy
node.hasNote: Consideration of philosophical questions about an individual's responsibility and obligations to society.

node.label: South American History
node.hasNote: Historical studies of South and Latin America.

node.label: South East Asian History
node.hasNote: Historical studies of South East Asia.

node.label: Southern African History
node.hasNote: Historical studies of Southern Africa including South Africa.

node.label: Stone Age
node.hasNote: The archaeology of the period of human culture characterised by the making and use of stone implements and artefacts.

node.label: The Bible and Christian texts
node.hasNote: Includes study of the Old and New Testaments the apocryphal writings and patristic exegesis.

node.label: The Qu'ran and Islamic texts
node.hasNote: Includes study of the Qu'ran (Koran) and interpretation of Sharia.

node.label: The Torah and Judaic texts
node.hasNote: Includes study of the Torah and Talmudic interpretation.

node.label: Theology
node.hasNote: Interpretation of doctrinal concepts such as faith revelation and grace.

node.label: Theology and Religious studies
node.hasNote: The study of the nature of divinity and of beliefs in their social context.

node.label: Theology and Religious studies not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Theology and Religious studies categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: USA History
node.hasNote: Historical studies of the United States of America.

node.label: Welsh History
node.hasNote: Historical studies of Wales.

node.label: West African History
node.hasNote: Historical studies of West Africa.

node.label: World History
node.hasNote: Historical studies considered globally.

node.label: Acting
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the communication of dramatic information ideas moods and feelings through the achievement of naturalistic and believable behaviour in imaginary circumstances.

node.label: Animation Techniques
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the particular techniques associated with the creation of the illusion of movement in a video sequence by the filming of successive drawings or the positions of puppets.

node.label: Basketry
node.hasNote: The craft of constructing containers from interwoven cane or reeds.

node.label: Blacksmithing
node.hasNote: The craft of creating artefacts from iron.

node.label: Body Awareness
node.hasNote: The study of the human body in relation to its capabilities in generating artistic forms in dance.

node.label: Bookbinding
node.hasNote: The craft of constructing decorative and ornate bindings for hand-printed books.

node.label: Cabinet making
node.hasNote: The craft of creating items of wooden furniture.

node.label: Calligraphy
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the artistic construction of hand-written text.

node.label: Carpentry/Joinery
node.hasNote: The craft of laying-out fabricating erecting installing and repairing wooden structures and fixtures.

node.label: Ceramics Design
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the design of ceramic artefacts.

node.label: Choreography
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the arrangement and planning of staged dance.

node.label: Cinematics and Photography
node.hasNote: The study of all aspects of film making.

node.label: Cinematics and Photography not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Cinematics and Photography categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Cinematography
node.hasNote: The study of the purely artistic elements of moving image sequences.

node.label: Clay and Stone Crafts
node.hasNote: The study of all crafts which involve the use of clay stone and related materials.

node.label: Clock/Watchmaking
node.hasNote: The craft of creating chronometers.

node.label: Clothing/Fashion Design
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the design and use of textiles and other materials to create items of apparel.

node.label: Crafts
node.hasNote: The study of the use of a variety of materials individually and in combination to create pleasing and useful items. Includes a high proportion of practical work.

node.label: Crafts not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Crafts categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Creative Arts and Design not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Others in Creative Arts and Design categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Dance
node.hasNote: The study of and/or training in the movement of the body particularly in time to music. May include some study of/training in music and/or drama.

node.label: Dance not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Dance categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Design studies
node.hasNote: The study of design for everyday objects taking into account technology and commerce as well as appearance and current art thinking. May involve the use of computers as design tools.

node.label: Design studies not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Design studies categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Directing Motion Pictures
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the direction and arrangement of equipment and actors in the production of a moving image sequence.

node.label: Directing for Theatre
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the supervision and direction of dramatic performances.

node.label: Drama
node.hasNote: The study of and/or training in acting and stagecraft. May include the study of theatre management and the supervision and production of scenery costume lighting etc.

node.label: Drama not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Drama categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Drawing
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the expression of emotions ideas or views of reality through representation by lines on a surface. Includes the use of such media as pen & ink pencil charcoal pastel etc.

node.label: Dressmaking
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the creation of items of apparel.

node.label: Fabric and Leather Crafts
node.hasNote: The study of all crafts which are based upon the source materials of fabric and leather.

node.label: Film & Sound Recording
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the recording of audio and video elements in the production of a moving image sequence.

node.label: Fine Art
node.hasNote: The aesthetic representation in one medium of what is reality in another. Encompasses all artistic media.

node.label: Fine Art Conservation
node.hasNote: The study of the conservation protection and restoration of fine art artefacts.

node.label: Fine Art not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Fine Art categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Furniture Design
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the design of furniture for residential commercial and public environments.

node.label: Glass Crafts
node.hasNote: All crafts which involve the use of glass as a source material.

node.label: Glassblowing
node.hasNote: The craft of constructing glass vessels by means of blowing into molten glass.

node.label: Graphic Design
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the use of artistic techniques effectively to communicate ideas and information to business and consumer audiences via forms of printed media.

node.label: History of Cinematics
node.hasNote: The study of the development of the generating of moving images.

node.label: History of Cinematics and Photography
node.hasNote: The study of the development of moving image and still image generation.

node.label: History of Dance
node.hasNote: The study of the development of dance in societies and cultures.

node.label: History of Music
node.hasNote: The study of the historical development of music and musical styles.

node.label: History of Photography
node.hasNote: The study of the development of the generating of still images.

node.label: Illustration
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the use of artistic techniques effectively to communicate ideas and information to business and consumer audiences via drawn or painted images.

node.label: Imaginative Writing
node.hasNote: The study of the creation of fictional text.

node.label: Imaginative Writing not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Imaginative Writing categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Industrial/Product Design
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the design of industrial and consumer products to meet aesthetic functional and commercial requirements.

node.label: Interactive and Electronic Design
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the design of non static computer-generated images.

node.label: Interior Design
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the use of artistic techniques in the planning designing equipping and furnishing of residential commercial and public interior spaces.

node.label: Leatherwork
node.hasNote: The craft involved with the creation or decoration of items made from animal skin.

node.label: Marquetry and Inlaying
node.hasNote: The craft of decorating wooden items by inlaying patterns of thin layers of wood brass ivory etc.

node.label: Metal Crafts
node.hasNote: The study of all crafts which use metals as a source material.

node.label: Moving Image Techniques
node.hasNote: The study of the techniques and principles associated with the production of moving image sequences.

node.label: Multimedia Design
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the use of artistic techniques in design using a variety of materials.

node.label: Music
node.hasNote: The study of melody harmony and rhythm produced in accordance with specified patterns and sequences. May include performance theory and history of music.

node.label: Music not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Music categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Musical Instrument History
node.hasNote: Historical studies of the development of musical instruments in the context of changing styles of playing and performance.

node.label: Musicianship/Performance studies
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the mastering of musical instruments and performing art as solo and/or ensemble performers.

node.label: Musicology
node.hasNote: The systematic study of the forms and methods of music art and the functions of music in societies and cultures.

node.label: Needlecraft
node.hasNote: The study of crafts which draw upon the use of needles in create and decorate fabric and leather artefacts.

node.label: Origami
node.hasNote: The Japanese craft of folding paper into decorative shapes and figures.

node.label: Others in Creative Arts and Design
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Creative Arts and Design categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Painting
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the expression of emotions ideas or views of reality through representation by the application of paints and chemical colour substances to canvasses or other materials.

node.label: Paper Crafts
node.hasNote: The study of all crafts which involve the making or use of paper as a source material.

node.label: Photography
node.hasNote: The study of/training in all aspects in the creation of still images on photographic film or plates.

node.label: Poetry Writing
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the writing of poems.

node.label: Pottery
node.hasNote: The craft of creating vessels and artefacts from fired clay.

node.label: Printmaking
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the expression of emotions ideas or views of reality by rendering art concepts onto surfaces and transferring images via ink or dyes onto paper or fabric.

node.label: Producing Motion Pictures
node.hasNote: The study of/training in all aspects of the production of a moving image sequence other than acting and directing.

node.label: Producing for Theatre
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the techniques and principles involved in the production of theatrical performances other than acting and directing.

node.label: Prose Writing
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the writing of prose.

node.label: Reed Crafts
node.hasNote: The study of all crafts which involve the use of reeds and related materials.

node.label: Scriptwriting
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the writing of scripts for theatre/television or motion picture productions.

node.label: Sculpture
node.hasNote: The representation of reality using three-dimensional media e.g. stone metal wood etc.

node.label: Silversmithing/Goldsmithing
node.hasNote: The craft of creating artefacts using the materials of silver and gold.

node.label: Soft Furnishing
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the creation of soft furnishing items.

node.label: Stage Design
node.hasNote: The study of the design of sets and scenery for use in theatres film and television.

node.label: Stage Management
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the management of lighting props scenery and other technical items associated with theatrical performances.

node.label: Stone Crafts
node.hasNote: The craft of creating decorative and functional items from stone. May include dry-stone walling.

node.label: Surface Decoration
node.hasNote: The study of all crafts which involve changing the appearance of objects by adding ornament or colour to their outer layer.

node.label: Textile Design
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the design of textiles.

node.label: Thatching
node.hasNote: The study of the craft of traditional roofing using straw reeds or similar materials.

node.label: Theatre Design
node.hasNote: The study of the design of theatres and theatre productions.

node.label: Theatre studies
node.hasNote: The study of the technical aspects of theatrical performances.

node.label: Theatrical Make-up
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the application of make-up and/or face and body paints for theatrical performances.

node.label: Theatrical Wardrobe Design
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the design of costumes for theatrical performances.

node.label: Tile Making
node.hasNote: The craft of creating decorative and functional tiles from clay and ceramic materials.

node.label: Types of Dance
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the specific styles and genres of dance.

node.label: Types of Music
node.hasNote: The study of specific types and variants of musical genres.

node.label: Typography
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the use of artistic techniques in the design and production of printed matter.

node.label: Veneering
node.hasNote: The craft of bonding thin outer layers of wood brass ivory etc to items for decorative purposes.

node.label: Visual Communication
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the use of artistic techniques in design to impart information.

node.label: Visual and Audio Effects
node.hasNote: The study of/training in the production of special visual and/or audio effects in the production of moving image sequences.

node.label: Weaving
node.hasNote: The craft of interweaving fibres of material such as cotton wool etc.

node.label: Wood Crafts
node.hasNote: The study of all crafts which involve the use of wood as a source material.

node.label: Academic studies in Adult Education
node.hasNote: The study of teaching and learning the arrangement of the curriculum and the investigation of the learning process in order to improve learning ability and efficiency in adults.

node.label: Academic studies in Education
node.hasNote: The study of teaching and learning the arrangement of the curriculum and the investigation of the learning process in order to improve group learning ability and efficiency.

node.label: Academic studies in Education (across phases)
node.hasNote: The study of teaching and learning the arrangement of the curriculum and the investigation of the learning process in order to improve learning ability and efficiency in people of all ages.

node.label: Academic studies in Education not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Academic studies in Education categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Academic studies in Further Education
node.hasNote: The study of teaching and learning the arrangement of the curriculum and the investigation of the learning process in order to improve learning ability and efficiency in people in education years 12 to 13 inclusive.

node.label: Academic studies in Higher Education
node.hasNote: The study of teaching and learning the arrangement of the curriculum and the investigation of the learning process in order to improve learning ability and efficiency in people in higher education.

node.label: Academic studies in Nursery Education
node.hasNote: The study of teaching and learning the arrangement of the curriculum and the investigation of the learning process in order to improve learning ability and efficiency in pre-school children.

node.label: Academic studies in Primary Education
node.hasNote: The study of teaching and learning the arrangement of the curriculum and the investigation of the learning process in order to improve learning ability and efficiency in children in school years 1 to 6 inclusive.

node.label: Academic studies in Secondary Education
node.hasNote: The study of teaching and learning the arrangement of the curriculum and the investigation of the learning process in order to improve learning ability and efficiency in children in school years 7 to 11 inclusive.

node.label: Academic studies in Specialist Education
node.hasNote: The study of teaching and learning the arrangement of the curriculum and the investigation of the learning process in order to improve learning ability and efficiency in people with particular learning requirements.

node.label: Academic studies in Tertiary Education
node.hasNote: The study of teaching and learning the arrangement of the curriculum and the investigation of the learning process in order to improve learning ability and efficiency in people above school year 11.

node.label: Education not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Others in Education categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Others in Education
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into the other Education categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Research and Study Skills in Education
node.hasNote: The study of investigative method and the collection of information with the aim of improving individual learning ability and efficiency.

node.label: Research and Study skills not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Research and Study skills categories. To be used sparingly.

node.label: Research skills
node.hasNote: The study of investigative method and the collection of information.

node.label: Study skills
node.hasNote: The study of individual learning ability and techniques with the aim of improving their efficacy and efficiency.

node.label: Teaching English as a Foreign Language (TEFL)
node.hasNote: The training of others to use non-standard methods to teach English to people whose first language is not English.

node.label: Training Teachers
node.hasNote: The training of others to impart explain and disseminate knowledge skills and learning to a third party.

node.label: Training Teachers - (key stage 3)
node.hasNote: The training of others to impart explain and disseminate knowledge skills and learning to children in school years 7 to 9 inclusive.

node.label: Training Teachers - (key stage 4)
node.hasNote: The training of others to impart explain and disseminate knowledge skills and learning to children in school years 10 to 11 inclusive.

node.label: Training Teachers - Adult Education
node.hasNote: The training of others to impart explain and disseminate knowledge skills and learning to adults. May include teaching of management training techniques restructuring of teaching methods to take account of part-time study etc.

node.label: Training Teachers - Coaching
node.hasNote: The training of others to impart explain and disseminate knowledge skills and learning to sportsmen and women.

node.label: Training Teachers - Further Education
node.hasNote: The training of others to impart explain and disseminate knowledge skills and learning to people in education years 12 to 13 inclusive.

node.label: Training Teachers - Higher Education
node.hasNote: The training of others to impart explain and disseminate knowledge skills and learning to people registered on a higher education course.

node.label: Training Teachers - Infant (key stage 1)
node.hasNote: The training of others to impart explain and disseminate knowledge skills and learning to children in school years 1 and 2 inclusive.

node.label: Training Teachers - Junior (key stage 2)
node.hasNote: The training of others to impart explain and disseminate knowledge skills and learning to children in school years 3 to 6 inclusive.

node.label: Training Teachers - Nursery
node.hasNote: The training of others to impart explain and disseminate knowledge skills and learning to pre-school children.

node.label: Training Teachers - Primary
node.hasNote: The training of others to impart explain and disseminate knowledge skills and learning to children in school years 1 to 6 inclusive.

node.label: Training Teachers - Secondary
node.hasNote: The training of others to impart explain and disseminate knowledge skills and learning to children in school years 7 to 11 inclusive.

node.label: Training Teachers - Special Needs
node.hasNote: The training of others to use non-standard methods to impart explain and disseminate knowledge skills and learning to people with special needs.

node.label: Training Teachers - Specialist
node.hasNote: The training of others to use non-standard methods to impart explain and disseminate knowledge skills and learning to people with particular learning requirements.

node.label: Training Teachers - Tertiary
node.hasNote: The training of others to impart explain and disseminate knowledge skills and learning to people above school year 11.

node.label: Training Teachers not elsewhere classified
node.hasNote: Miscellaneous grouping for related subjects which do not fit into other Training Teachers categories. To be used sparingly.
